name: mkcert-web-ui
description: mkcertWeb is a browser-based interface built over mkcert to create local SSL certificates easily. It wraps certificate generation into a clean UI to simplify development environment setup.
features: Certificate Generation: Create local SSL certificates for development environments through a simple web interface.
Domain Management: Generate certificates for multiple domains and subdomains with wildcard support.
Browser Integration: Automatically install root certificates in system trust stores for seamless HTTPS development.
Development Workflow: Streamline local development setup with one-click certificate creation and installation.
Certificate Authority: Manage your own local certificate authority for consistent development environment security.
Export Options: Download certificates in various formats including PEM, CRT, and KEY files for different applications.
Batch Processing: Generate multiple certificates simultaneously for complex development environments.
Visual Interface: User-friendly web UI that simplifies the mkcert command-line tool for non-technical users.
Security Best Practices: Follow industry standards for certificate generation and key management in development.
Cross-platform Support: Works across Windows, macOS, and Linux development environments consistently.
Integration Ready: Easy integration with Docker, Nginx, Apache, and other development tools and containers.
Localhost Testing: Perfect for testing HTTPS functionality on localhost and local network development servers.
